body:
Hi @josebenitezg,

Thanks for using Diffgram and sharing this. Can I ask you if you could share the walrus service logs on docker compose? There might be some extra information we could use to further help you out

Yes, sure. There you go. Thank you for your fast reply. Even though we are able to connect successfully with the bucket when we try to upload show this error.

Thanks for sharing the logs :) 

The problem seem to me to be a permission with that bucket specifically when downloading the generated signed URL.

We are going to work on improving the error messages to give more information about the missing permissions in the next releases of Diffgram.

For now to debug your issue, could you please try generating a signed URL, and then accessing it with your S3 client? 

It seems that the problem is related to that .

A way to do it with Python and boto3 is

```
client = boto3.client('s3', aws_access_key_id=your_id, aws_secret_access_key=your_secret)
signed_url = client.generate_presigned_url('get_object', 
            Params={'Bucket': ,<YOUR BUCKET NAME>,'Key': <YOUR OBJECT PATH>},
            ExpiresIn=3600 * 24 * 6)  # 5 Days.


```

Check if you are getting any permissions error both to generate the signed URL and to access the URL. 

It could also help if you could double check if that fullS3Access roles is correctly attached to the Access Key you added in Diffgram. You can share the policy here to to further debug.

I don't get any errors. I am able to generate the signed URL successfully.
I also double check the Access key have the fulls3Access
![Captura de Pantalla 2021-07-19 a la(s) 15 58 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58047828/126212868-5984cc93-224e-44dd-ab62-e094affcb4d3.png)

> I also double check the Access key have the fulls3Access

This could be a problem right?

> > > I also double check the Access key have the fulls3Access

> 
> This could be a problem right?

Yes, that is most likely the issue. Can you test with another bucker or region in your AWS account?

Here are some resources to the related error:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26533245/the-authorization-mechanism-you-have-provided-is-not-supported-please-use-aws4

So, now apparently work because I have success to upload the images after change the s3 properties. But I face a new problem jajaja. I don't why the images do not show. This error show me even if I upload the images from my computer.

> So, now apparently work because I have success to upload the images after change the s3 properties. But I face a new problem jajaja. I don't why the images do not show. > > > > > This error show me even if I upload the images from my computer. Thanks for the info @josebenitezg. Can you please check on your network tab in the explorer if the image fetching is throwing an error and share that with us? I suspect that URL will have the same problem you showed above.

So, I was able to finde the solution. The main problem was that the first configuration of aws was with other bucket that hasn't the same permission as the new one that I've created.
Now everything looks fine. I'll try to upload a big dataset to annotate (300k images).
That number of dataset shouldn't be a problem right?

Thank you for your help @PJEstrada !
sorry I close the issue for error

Hey @josebenitezg  glad you got it working :)

Diffgram should be able to handle large datasets, other users had been able to upload multi GB videos and we recently uploaded the 120K images COCO dataset.

The only consideration here is processing time, which is mostly given by the amount of workers and the machine specs:

Here's a bit more information on the topic:
https://diffgram.readme.io/docs/file-processing-performances

Let me know if this helps you and we can close the issue

Hi @PJEstrada We are trying to upload aprox 17k images from s3, now we are able to do it but we are facing another problem. It seems that we have 999+ object in the bucket and when we import the data only upload the first 999 objects which is the first page on s3.

> Hi @PJEstrada We are trying to upload aprox 17k images from s3, now we are able to do it but we are facing another problem. > > It seems that we have 999+ object in the bucket and when we import the data only upload the first 999 objects which is the first page on s3. > > > > Hello @josebenitezg, thanks for sharing this one. You're right, for now we still don't yet support pagination at the UI level, but if you just select the entire `batch_1/` folder, and unselect the individual files, it should fetch all the items on the folder regardless of not showing them on the UI. We will add a separate issue to support pagination on the file browser for really large folders on the UI. Let me know if this works for you!
